For over 85 years, we have pioneered significant medical innovations that transform healthcare.Together, we create a place where we are happy, successful and inspire each other. Baxter tr√§gt dieser Entwicklung Rechnung und setzt mit seinen intelligenten und vernetzten L√∂sungen neue Ma√üst√§be.F√ºr unseren Standort in Saalfeld (Th√ºringen) suchen wir Sie als Mechanical Engineer (m/w/d) - R&D im Bereich Sustaining Engineering.Ihre Aufgabe      Teilprojektleitung und Koordinierung des √Ñnderungsmanagements in der SerienentwicklungKontinuierliche √úberwachung der Kostensenkungsinitiativen und Erkennen von m√∂glichen Herausforderungen sowie Steuerung von Ma√ünahmen zur Einhaltung der Kosten-, Termin- und Qualit√§tsziele im TeamEnge Zusammenarbeit mit Produktion, Qualit√§tsmanagement, Service, Einkauf und ProduktmanagementErstellung und Anpassung von Spezifikationen und Anforderungsdokumenten an MechanikbaugruppenAbleiten von technischen L√∂sungen anhand der Anforderungen f√ºr komplexe Baugruppen, Bewertung von L√∂sungen unter Ber√ºcksichtigung technologischer und wirtschaftlicher AspekteErstellung und Anpassung von 3D-Modellen sowie von fertigungsgerechten ZeichnungenTechnische Abstimmung mit den LieferantenDurchf√ºhrung und Dokumentation von FunktionstestsErstellung und Update der Dokumentation des Design History Files (DHF), z.B. Design-Input, Design-Output, Risikomanagement, Verifikation und Validierung
Ihr Profil      Abgeschlossenes Studium der Mechatronik, Maschinenbau, Feinwerktechnik oder eines vergleichbaren StudiengangsMehrj√§hrige Berufserfahrung in der mechanischen Konstruktion von Produkten mit Siemens NX oder √§hnlichen CAD-System erforderlichKenntnisse hinsichtlich FEM-Analyse w√ºnschenswertErfahrung im regulierten Umfeld (EN ISO 13485, euMDR, 21 CFR 820, Medical Design Controls, Risikomanagement f√ºr Medizinprodukte) w√ºnschenswertKenntnisse im ERP-System SAP R3 und Polarion w√ºnschenswertGute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift erforderlichEigenverantwortliches, strukturiertes, selbst√§ndiges und l√∂sungsorientiertes ArbeitenTeam- und Kommunikationsf√§higkeit
Ihre BewerbungBitte bewerben Sie sich unter Angabe Ihrer Entgeltvorstellungen und des fr√ºhestm√∂glichen Eintrittstermins. Als international t√§tiges Unternehmen bieten wir Ihnen interessante berufliche Perspektiven, ein kooperatives Arbeitsumfeld sowie ein leistungsorientiertes Entgelt. Genie√üen Sie die Vorz√ºge flexibler Arbeitszeitmodelle sowie unsere Programme zur Weiterbildung, Gesundheitsf√∂rderung und betrieblichen Altersvorsorge.Noch Fragen?Bei R√ºckfragen steht Ihnen sebastian_lange@baxter.com aus unserem Talent Acquisition Team gerne zur Verf√ºgung.Baxter is committed to supporting the needs for flexibility in the workplace.         IABG was founded in 1961 as a central analysis and testing organisation for the aerospace industry and the Ministry of Defence as part of an initiative by the German government. Today, IABG is a leading European technology and science service provider. We employ about 1,000 highly qualified employees at 16 locations in Germany and the EU. The service spectrum of IABG covers analytical, technical and operational solutions in the following sectors:  ‚Ä¢Automotive‚Ä¢InfoCom‚Ä¢Mobility, Energy & Environment‚Ä¢Aeronautics‚Ä¢Space‚Ä¢Defence & SecurityIABG was privatised in 1993 and is now managed by its owners. We are independent of commercial affiliation, hardware-neutral and exclusively represent the interests of our customers, who include national and international companies as well as the public sector. For over 50 years we have followed the life cycles of technical systems, in particular the development, qualification and operational phases. In so doing, we make use of the synergies arising from the combination of the various competencies within the company.

jobs.title: Space Flight Dynamics Engineer
jobs.description:
About the job
            

            
                
                  Your missionJoin us in safeguarding the sustainability of space operations through advanced space situational awareness (SSA) technologies. As part of our team, you will develop cutting-edge collision avoidance algorithms, enhance space situational awareness, and innovate tools for satellite operators. Your expertise in data science and physics will help us detect, predict, and mitigate orbital risks, ensuring safe and sustainable space exploration.Your Tasks And Responsibilities      You will collaborate with a multidisciplinary team of aerospace engineers, data scientists, and software developers to integrate and optimize third-party sensor data sources within our SSA platform. Your contributions will directly enhance the accuracy, automation, and scalability of our orbital risk management solutions.Integrate third-party data sources into our platform, working closely with providers to seamlessly onboard their data.Develop, implement, and optimize high-precision algorithms for orbit propagation, orbit determination (OD), sensor fusion, covariance modelling, and uncertainty quantification.Develop methods to fuse data from diverse sources into one common image of the space debris environment.Conduct validation and verification (V&V) campaigns to benchmark and refine algorithmic performance against ground truth datasets.Work closely with software engineers to transition prototype algorithms into scalable, production-ready solutions.
Your profileMust-have      M.Sc. or higher in Aerospace Engineering, Space Engineering, Applied Mathematics, Applied Physics, or a closely related field, or have prior work experience in the field of SSA/SST or Space Flight Dynamics.A minimum of 2 years of relevant work experience is required. Strong theoretical and practical knowledge of astrodynamics, orbital mechanics, and flight dynamics.Experience in scientific programming using at least one of the following languages: Java, Fortran (90+) or Python.Ability to work in a fast-paced, collaborative, and research-driven environment.This position is only open to candidates currently based in Germany or willing to relocate.Valid working permit for Germany/EU.
Nice-to-have:      Hands-on experience with space surveillance and tracking (SST) systems, including sensor tasking and catalog maintenance.Experience working with space agencies or private space companies in the SSA/SST field.Familiarity with space surveillance and tracking systems.Understanding of space policy and compliance frameworks.Experience with AI/ML applications for anomaly detection, pattern recognition, or orbit prediction in SSA applications.Interest in contributing to the sustainability of space and long-term spaceflight operations.
Why us?      With a lean hierarchy and small working groups, you define your own way of work including flexible work hours.Work on groundbreaking space sustainability challenges with a team of top-tier engineers and scientists.After your on-boarding time in Braunschweig, you can choose between staying in our office, working remote (within Germany) or a hybrid approach.Enjoy technical freedom. Influence system architecture, research methodologies, and data integration approaches.Grow continuously with access to training budgets, industry conferences, and networking opportunities.Be part of a strong engineering culture, with regular knowledge-sharing sessions, technical deep dives, and innovation sprints.Great team spirit, with company-wide events such as monthly all-hands lunches, and social activities like laser tag, dinners, and team-building outings.
About UsOKAPI:Orbits is at the forefront of space sustainability, addressing some of the most pressing challenges of the space industry: the growing problem of crowded orbital regimes, and the need for more efficient satellite operations. We're providing end-to-end solutions that help various space industry players cover their Space Situation Awareness (SSA), and Space Traffic Management and Coordination (STM & STC) needs. We are committed to safeguarding space missions and access to space for all humanity. Join us on our mission.

                  Am Institut f√ºr Elektrifizierte Luftfahrtantriebe forschen wir an zuk√ºnftigen emissions√§rmeren Luftfahrtantrieben f√ºr zivile Transportflugzeuge und entwickeln neue Technologien zur Reduzierung von klimasch√§dlichen Treibhausgasen.Das erwartet dichDie Abteilung Umweltwirkungen und Sensorik (UWS) besch√§ftigt sich mit den Umweltwirkungen elektrifizierter Luftfahrtantriebe inklusive Vibrationen und Schall durch die einzelnen Komponenten des elektrischen oder hybrid-elektrischen Antriebsstrangs sowie mit der Entwicklung angepasster Sensorik und zugeh√∂riger Signalverarbeitungsverfahren.Deine Aufgaben      numerische und experimentelle Untersuchung von Fehlerbildern in (hybrid-)elektrischen Antriebssystemen - vor allem Elektromotor, Getriebe und Leistungselektronik - unter Ber√ºcksichtigung der besonderen Anforderungen der Antriebstechnik in der Luftfahrttheoretische und experimentelle Bearbeitung von wissenschaftlichen Forschungsaufgaben im Bereich der Sensorik und DatenverarbeitungAkquise, Durchf√ºhrung und Dokumentation von Projekten und Ver√∂ffentlichung der Ergebnisse in Fachpublikationen und auf wissenschaftlichen KonferenzenEntwicklung von robusten Zustands√ºberwachungsmethoden f√ºr den elektrischen Antrieb unter Ber√ºcksichtigung der besonderen Anforderungen der Antriebstechnik in der LuftfahrtWahrnehmung allgemeiner Institutsaufgaben, beispielsweise Vertretung des Instituts auf Messen und √∂ffentlichen Veranstaltungen, Mitwirkung bei institutsinternen Veranstaltungen, kollegiale Beratung 
Das bringst du mit      abgeschlossenes wissenschaftliches Hochschulstudium (Master/ Uni-Diplom) in der Studienrichtung Elektrotechnik, Maschinenbau, Physik oder andere f√ºr die T√§tigkeit relevanten Studieng√§ngeKenntnisse im Bereich der Signalverarbeitung und der mathematischen ModellierungErfahrung im Bereich der numerischen Simulation (CAA, CFD, numerische Modalanalyse)Erfahrung mit Programmiersprachen wie Python oder Matlab/Simulinksehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift 
Wir freuen uns darauf, dich kennenzulernen!Fragen Zu Dieser Position (Kennziffer 1736) Beantwortet Dir GerneThomas Fritz Geyer Tel.: +49 355 28888 015

        DLR is the Federal Republic of Germany‚Äôs research centre for aeronautics and space. We conduct research and development activities in the fields of aeronautics, space, energy, transport, security and digitalisation. The German Space Agency at DLR plans and implements the national space programme on behalf of the federal government. Two DLR project management agencies oversee funding programmes and support knowledge transfer. Climate, mobility and technology are changing globally. DLR uses the expertise of its 55 research institutes and facilities to develop solutions to these challenges. Our 10,000 employees share a mission ‚Äì to explore Earth and space and develop technologies for a sustainable future. In doing so, DLR contributes to strengthening Germany‚Äôs position as a prime location for research and industry.Sounds exciting? Well, it is! At 30 locations, our scientists work on a unique variety of fascinating topics, tasks and projects. Their studies involve finding answers to the essential questions of our times and are laying the foundations for how we will live tomorrow.Whether atmospheric research, planetary research, solar technology, traffic management, aero elasticity, environmental monitoring, space medicine or another exciting research field ‚Äì the chances are that you too will be able to realize your mission at one of our institutes. But no matter where your career at DLR might begin ‚Äì whether in basic research or technology development ‚Äì everything we do is aimed at benefiting society and future generations. In addition, our work contributes to ensuring Germany‚Äôs international competitiveness as a high-tech hub. Why not join us? jobs.title: Junior Device Modeling Engineer
jobs.description:
About the job
            

            
                
                  About GlobalFoundriesGlobalFoundries‚ÄØis a leading full-service semiconductor foundry providing a unique combination of design, development, and fabrication services to some of the world‚Äôs most inspired technology companies. With a global manufacturing footprint spanning three continents, GlobalFoundries makes possible the technologies and systems that transform industries and give customers the power to shape their markets. For more information, visit www.gf.com.Summary Of RoleThis position is for a Junior SPICE modeling expertise who will primarily work on the compact device model development with focus on SRAM and coordination between modeling and device team.Essential Responsibilities      Development of SPICE models for FET device covering SRAM, base band, high voltage, RF for GF technologiesDevelopment of SRAM modeling with close interaction with Fab1 SRAM teamFoster a strong interlock between modeling and device teamDrive best practices in model extraction, QA/ validation & flow across model organizationsWorking closely with Fab engineers on device characterization, Data analysis and Model Hardware Correlation & data acceptance criteriaWork with measurement and layout teams on modeling test chip generation to enable testing of wafers across different work sites/ regionsProvide technical support on customers' queries on SPICE model & help to resolve model related issues in a timely manner
Other Responsibilities      Perform all activities in a safe and responsible manner and support all Environmental, Health, Safety & Security requirements and programs
Required Qualifications      Master's in electrical engineering or physics Must have in-depth Semiconductor device physics knowledgeUnderstanding of SPICE level simulators such as HSPICE, SPECTREFluency in English Language ‚Äì written & verbalExcellent ability to meet tight deadlines, commitments and deliver customer requirements
Preferred Qualifications      Experience in a foundry environment supporting multiple technology nodes and productsProject management skills - i.e., the ability to innovate and execute on solutions that matter; the ability to navigate ambiguityStrong written and verbal communication skillsStrong planning & organizational skills
We Offer The position is open-ended and to be filled as soon as possible.Attractive Compensation Components13th month salary, bonus payments, assistance with relocation to Dresden.Flexible Working Time ArrangementsFamily friendly part-time models, trust flextime, salary conversion into free timeDiverse Opportunities For Further DevelopmentCareer stages for every job, internal qualification offers, promotion of external educational qualificationsFocus On Your HealthOn-site gym and beach volleyball court, bike leasing, subsidized employee restaurantCorporate CultureCooperation at eye level - everyone is on first name terms with us, budget for individual team events, social commitment via GlobalGivesYou can find more benefits in detail at https://gf.com/de/careers/benefits/Diversity is part of our corporate DNA. For this reason, we would like to encourage women in particular to apply for a job with us. As we value equal opportunities and inclusion is particularly important to us, we welcome applications from people with disabilities.Information about our benefits you can find here: https://gf.com/careers/opportunities-in-europe/

jobs.title: Lead Engineer FEA/CFD Simulation
jobs.description:
About the job
            

            
                
                  Your contribution:We seek a Mechanical/Thermal/Chemical Engineer with expertise in FEA/CFD and AI to develop advanced simulation models for battery systems. This role focuses on supporting Reduced Order Models (ROM), digital twin technology, and the use of optiSLang for optimizing thermal and mechanical designs. The successful candidate will work collaboratively with cross-functional teams to enhance the design and simulation capabilities of our advanced battery systems.This role is based in Hannover, GermanyKey Responsibilities: What you will doMultiphysics Modeling & Simulation      Perform FEA/CFD analysis using LS-DYNA, ANSYS Workbench, Fluent UDFs, and APDL scripting to model thermal runaway, mechanical stress, and failure modes in lithium-ion batteries. Develop first-principles thermal/electrochemical models for heat generation, thermal gradients, and cooling efficiency under extreme conditions. Simulate mechanical damage (crush, vibration) using fracture mechanics and composite material failure criteria. 
Digital Twin Development:      Support the creation and implementation of digital twins for battery systems to simulate real-world performance and predict outcomes. Ensure digital twins are aligned with performance targets and validated against experimental data. 
Design Optimization:      Leverage AI/ML tools to optimize design parameters and improve thermal and mechanical performance. Conduct sensitivity analyses and parameter studies to identify critical design variables. 
Thermal and Mechanical Design:      Perform thermal and mechanical simulations to assess design feasibility and performance. Collaborate with design engineers to refine and improve designs based on simulation results. 
Collaboration and Reporting:      Work closely with cross-functional teams, including systems engineers and design teams, to align simulation efforts with overall project goals. Document methodologies, simulation results, and optimization strategies, and present findings to technical and non-technical stakeholders. 
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities: What we look forEducation: Master‚Äôs/PhD in Mechanical, Thermal, or Chemical Engineering (or related field).Technical Skills:       Expertise in ANSYS Workbench, LS-DYNA, Fluent UDFs, APDL, or Abaqus.  Proficiency in Python for AI/ML workflows (TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn).  Strong grasp of battery electrochemistry, thermal runaway mechanisms, and composite materials. 
Soft Skills: Collaborative problem-solving, customer-facing communication, and technical writing.Fluency in English and German.Preferred Skills       Experience with CFD for conjugate heat transfer in battery packs.  Familiarity with 3D CAD tools (SolidWorks, CATIA, spaceclaim, discovery) for geometry preprocessing.  Knowledge of Design Optimization, parametric optimization (Matlab, Discovery Simulation, OptisLang) Knowledge of high-performance computing (HPC) for large-scale simulations. 
Benefits: What we offer youAs a technology leader with strong brand (i.e. VARTA¬Æ and OPTIMA¬Æ), Clarios notably lives on the creativity, capability and satisfaction of its employees. Therefore, we offer people with drive and power many good reasons to join us:      Exciting professional tasks and challenges in a diverse international environment with strong commitment to integrity, values, social engagement and sustainability. Arrange your working hours and breaks flexible via our flexible and trust-based working hours model and combine your professional and private life even better according to our mobile work policy and company kindergarten. A competitive remuneration package, including additional payments such as holiday, Christmas as well as company pension program. Your well-being is very important to us: Take advantage of our preventive health care offers such as fitness center, physiotherapist, modern office environment, healthy canteen, team and company events or hobby clubs. Stay fit whilst at the same time positively contributing to our environment: Lease your company bike. Our well-advanced onboarding process and buddy program supports you to quickly grow into the position and team. By using the offering in our Internal Learning Academy, LinkedIn Learning and EMEA Mentoring Program you will be able to further grow professionally and personally. Last, but not least we support you in relocating and finding a flat in location surrounding if applicable and depending on individual factors. 
About Clarios: Clarios is the global leader in advanced, low-voltage battery technologies for mobility. Our batteries and smart solutions power nearly every type of vehicle and are found in 1 of 3 cars on the road today. With around 18,000 employees in over 100 countries, we bring deep expertise to our Aftermarket and OEM partners, and reliability, safety and comfort to everyday lives. We answer to the planet with a rigorous sustainability focus ‚Äì advancing best-in-class sustainability practices and advocating for them across our industry. We work to ensure 100% of our products sold are recyclable, and we recycle 8,000 batteries an hour in our network. You can find more information here (PDF).To all recruitment agencies: Clarios does not accept unsolicited agency resumes/CVs. Please do not forward resumes/CVs to our careers email addresses, Clarios employees or any other company location. Clarios is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes/CVs.Clarios, LLC is an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, protected veteran status, status as a qualified individual with a disability, or any other characteristic protected by law. For more information, please view EEO is the Law, EEO is the Law (supplement), and Pay Transparency Non-discrimination. If you are an individual with a disability and you require an accommodation during the application process, please email Special.Accommodations@Clarios.com.A Note to Job Applicants: please be aware of scams being perpetrated through the Internet and social media platforms. Clarios will never require a job applicant to pay money as part of the application or hiring process.

jobs.title: Development Engineer Thermal Analysis / Thermal Management (CFD) (f/m/d)
jobs.description:
About the job
            

            
                
                  CompanyHENSOLDT Optronics GmbHFull time / Part time:The position can be filled in full or part time.SummaryWe are looking for a ‚ÄúDevelopment Engineer Thermal Analysis / Thermal Management (CFD) (f/m/d)‚Äù for the ‚ÄúStructural and Thermal Analysis‚Äù department at the Oberkochen site as soon as possible.In the ‚ÄúStructural and Thermal Analysis‚Äù department, a wide variety of disciplines such as system engineering, optical design, construction and structural and thermal analysis are interlinked. We develop components, mechanisms and structures for optical systems that fulfill their performance data even under extreme conditions, such as strong vibration and extreme temperatures.Together with other development areas, this results in special optics, camera systems, laser rangefinders, integrated electromechanical-stabilized, multispectral reconnaissance systems for submarines, military vehicles, aircraft and satellites.Your Tasks       Thermal analyses for the evaluation and design of complex opto-mechanical systems using CFD analyses  Creation of power loss budgets  Definition of heat transfers and implementation of fluid-solid couplings  Carrying out simulations based on stationary and transient scenarios  Development and evaluation of thermal concepts for complete (sub-)systems  Creation of test procedures for environmental tests with regard to thermal requirements  Correlation of analysis results with test results  Supporting external partners in the area of thermal analysis  Presentation of results to customers (internal and external)  Working in interdisciplinary teams (mechanics, optics, electronics and software) 
Your Profile       Completed university degree in engineering or natural sciences in the field of mechanical engineering, aerospace engineering, automotive engineering or a comparable field of study  Professional experience as a calculation engineer for the thermal design of complex systems  Sound experience in thermal management of mechatronic systems  Experience in carrying out numerical flow simulations  Very good knowledge of thermodynamics, heat transfer and fluid mechanics  Very good knowledge in the application of CFD calculation tools (ideally FloEFD)  Sound knowledge of CAD systems for preparing the calculation models (ideally CREO)  Ideally knowledge of structural mechanical design / calculation  Communication and teamwork skills  Structured and independent way of working  Business fluent in German and advanced knowledge of English 
Happy to hear       Work on extraordinary high-tech products at the limits of physics  Fair, performance-related remuneration, plus special payments  Flexible working time and workplace models  Company pension scheme  Individual development and training opportunities  Family-friendly working conditions and meal & snack options  Health promotion and mobility offers 
Discover more about our benefits "HERE ".You want to become part of a future-oriented company? Are you ready to assume responsibility in exciting international and national projects? Then you YOU are our candidate (f/m/d)!Please apply exclusively online via our career portal with your CV and certificates.We aim to streamline our application process as much as possible and therefore do not require a cover letter.Be the pioneer of our future!We look forward to receiving your application!In case you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact our Talent Resourcing Team:E-Mail:jobs[AT]hensoldt.netHENSOLDT is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief.

        HENSOLDT is a leading company in the European defence industry with global reach. Based in Taufkirchen near Munich, the company develops complete sensor solutions for defence and security applications. As a technology leader, HENSOLDT drives the development of defence electronics and optronics and is continuously expanding its portfolio based on innovative approaches to data management, robotics and cyber security.In 2023, HENSOLDT achieved a turnover of 1.85 billion euros. Following the acquisition of ESG GmbH, the company employs around 8,500 people. HENSOLDT is listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange in the MDAX.HENSOLDT has 10 manufacturing sites - located in Germany, South Africa, the UK and France. Our company benefits from our international footprint with offices on all continents. Our Headquarter is located in Taufkirchen near Munich. Our main sites have all their own product lines and are located in innovative areas: Ulm, Taufkirchen, Friedrichshafen, Oberkochen, Wetzlar and Kiel in Germany, Pretoria and Irene in South Africa, Enfiled close to London, and Plaisir close to Paris. Why join us?We pioneer with passion to create competitive premium electronics. Our core competence is to detect and protect: we make an essential contribution to protecting people and nations. We offer various and challenging positions with development perspectives in a friendly and cooperative atmosphere in teams, where collaboration is a key value shared by everyone. jobs.title: Senior Aerodynamics Test Engineer
jobs.description:
About the job
            

            
                
                  Cadillac Formula 1‚Ñ¢ is excited to be on the grid for the 2026 FIA Formula One‚Ñ¢ World Championship. Our new team is gearing up for rapid growth. To achieve our goals, we need to create and sustain a high-performance culture in every area. We have ambitious plans to build an outstanding operation that can compete at the highest level. From exceptional Engineering and Design talent to a world-class race team, supported by specialists in off-track roles - we are assembling the expertise needed to drive this operation forward and compete at the highest level.  We have an exciting opportunity for a Senior Aerodynamics Test Engineer to join the Team to work in the wind tunnel facility in Cologne, Germany. In this role, you will be involved in supporting wind tunnel testing activities, and developing testing methodologies, processes and technologies. What you will be doing:¬∑ Support the development of experimental wind tunnel testing methodologies, processes and technologies.¬∑ Ensure consistent, efficient and high-quality testing at the wind tunnel facility.¬∑ Support the definition and documentation of wind tunnel testing practices and procedures.¬∑ Work closely with aerodynamics performance development engineers in defining and delivering upon requirements.¬∑ Monitoring and reporting operational efficiency and identifying areas of improvements.¬∑ Identifying potential improvements in testing approach and supporting the development of these where viable.¬∑ Support the development and integration of wind tunnel testing methodologies and technologies such as PIV, model motion and control, flow field measurements, metrology and other wind tunnel technologies and capabilities.¬∑ Investigate and research new and novel technologies, techniques and methodologies for wind tunnel systems including instrumentation, sensors and aerodynamic measurements etc.Requirements¬∑ Proven experience in a similar wind tunnel testing role within the formula 1 industry.¬∑ Experience of wind tunnel systems and testing facilities.¬∑ Excellent understanding of wind tunnel testing methodology and best practices.¬∑ Experience of off-body flow measurements operation and development.¬∑ Communicate effectively with key stakeholders/directors.¬∑ Strong levels of IT skills including MS Office, Word, Excel and PowerPoint.¬∑ Positively contribute to an open and inclusive culture.¬∑ Based in Cologne, Germany.Please be aware that we will be reviewing applicants on a rolling basis and this job posting will close once a suitable candidate is identified. We encourage all interested individuals to submit their application as soon as possible. As an equal opportunities' employer, we are committed to the equal treatment of all current and prospective employees and does not condone discrimination on the basis of age, disability, sex, sexual orientation, pregnancy or maternity, race or ethnicity, religion or belief, gender identity or marriage and civil partnership. We aspire to have a diverse and inclusive workplace and strongly encourage suitably qualified applicants from a wide range of backgrounds to apply.

jobs.title: Simulation & Teleoperation Engineer (m/f/d)
jobs.description:
About the job
            

            
                
                  Who We Are:We are a rapidly growing embodied AI company revolutionizing human labor. Leveraging cutting-edge robotics and advanced artificial intelligence, we develop transformative technologies that redefine how work is done across multiple industries‚Äîempowering businesses to streamline operations, boost productivity, and unlock new possibilities.Overview:We are looking for a Simulation & Teleoperation Engineer to develop cutting-edge simulation environments and teleoperation systems that empower advanced robotics and AI applications. In this role, you'll build simulation environments for testing AI models, develop robust teleoperation interfaces and tools, integrate simulation platforms with robotic systems, and continuously analyze and enhance simulation fidelity.Your Responsibilities:Development:      Build simulation environments for testing AI models.                   What To ExpectJoin Vehicle Engineering in Berlin to accelerate the world‚Äôs transition to sustainable energy where you will help design the next generation of Our world-class engineering teamsThe Tesla Dimensional Analysis team is critical to the engineering design and development of new products at Tesla. jobs.title: Lead Simulation Engineer - High Temperature Heat Pump (m/f/d)
jobs.description:
About the job
            

            
                
                  About UsHeaten stands for innovative solutions in the field of large-scale high-temperature heat pumps. Our technology, specifically designed for temperatures up to 200¬∞C, far exceeds the performance limits of conventional industrial heat pumps. With this, we make a significant contribution to the global energy transition and CO‚ÇÇ reduction. With locations in Germany and Norway, we work internationally to make industries more efficient and sustainable.To strengthen our team, we are looking for a highly skilled Lead Simulation Engineer to develop and implement a comprehensive simulation strategy for our high-temperature heat pump product line.This role requires expertise in model build-up, model simulation, and model validation methods for heat pump systems. The successful candidate will lead efforts to integrate simulation methodologies across the entire product lifecycle, from early engineering phases to customer application and sales tools.Your Responsibilities:      Develop and execute an end-to-end simulation strategy to support product development, optimization, and customer applications.Investigate the most valuable simulation approaches for product development and application, focusing on efficiency and accuracy.Explore new simulation tools to expand capabilities and enhance product analysis.Define standard model validation methods to ensure accuracy and reliability.Establish best practices for performing simulations effectively.Develop standardized methods for analyzing and reporting simulation results.Support development teams by providing simulation-based insights for their units.Collaborate with cross-functional teams to align simulation tools with engineering requirements and customer needs.Provide technical leadership and mentorship to the simulation engineering team, fostering a culture of innovation and continuous improvement.Integrate simulation results into sales tools to enhance customer engagement and product demonstrations.Stay up to date with industry trends and advancements in simulation technologies, applying them to improve product performance and efficiency.Communicate complex simulation results and insights effectively to various stakeholders, including engineers, sales teams, and customers.
Your Profile:      Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Mechanical Engineering, Chemical Engineering, or a related field.Proven experience in process simulation of heat pump systems.Expertise in simulation software such as ANSYS, MATLAB, GT-Suite, Aspen, Ebsilon, or similar platforms.Proficiency in Python for simulation and data analysis.Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret complex data sets.Excellent leadership and communication skills.Ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.An innovative mindset with a passion for driving technological advancements.
Preferred Qualifications:      PhD in a relevant field.Experience in the development of high-temperature heat pump systems.Familiarity with sales tools and customer application processes.
What We Offer:      A permanent position in a fast-growing, innovative company that contributes to the energy transition.The opportunity to lead testing operations for cutting-edge technology and sustainable solutions.A collaborative and supportive work environment within an international and multidisciplinary team.Flat hierarchies and short decision-making processes that encourage creativity and initiative.Flexible working arrangements to promote a healthy work-life balance.Competitive compensation and additional benefits.
Your OpportunityAre you ready to take on the challenge of revolutionizing the industrial heat pump market? Join Heaten and play an essential role in shaping a more sustainable future. Apply today and become part of our dynamic and innovative team!

jobs.title: Mechanical Development Engineer - Drone Technologies (m/f/d)
jobs.description:
About the job
            

            
                
                  As a development engineer, you will be a key part of our Mechanical Hardware Design team to bring your own ideas to the CAD design of new products. Together with our world-class team, currently 9 team members, you will take an empowering role: pushing the boundaries of drone technologies.You will be working closely with stakeholders from the Electronics, Prototyping and System Test department to solve complex problems in a goal-oriented manner and drive innovation. Development of mechanical systems to Quantum-Systems - your mission will be a powerful impact.What is your Day to Day Mission:      Development and design of UAV structural components and manufacturing tools (CATIA V5)Design and calculation (MATLAB, Python, VB.NET, Excel)Creation of technical drawings and manufacturing documentsIntegration of subsystems and payload in UAV on the hardware levelConstruction and testing of prototypes and support of small series productionProduct maintenanceDevelopment of the process chain of the Mechanical Hardware Design department
What you bring to the team:      You have completed an university degree in in the field of aerospace, mechanical engineering, automotive engineering.You already have practical experience in CAD development and working with a PLM system.You have good working knowledge of CATIA V5 and familiarity with common plastics manufacturing processes.You are privately interested in modeling or 3D printing.Due to your open, communicative, friendly and competent attitude, it is easy for you to be considered as an internal expert.You are highly self-motivated and drive your area of responsibility independently.Communication in English is a matter of course for you.
Why Quantum-Systems:      We believe in the power of combined efforts: straightforward tech expertise paired with a customer-centric focus.We are industry pioneers who are ambitious, bold, and visionary. We push limits, think outside-the-box and strive for technological excellence to shape the future of aerial data.We promise to be your runway for individual and professional growth.
Our benefits:      Company pension scheme: We support you so that you can already make provisions for later.Flexible working hours: With trust-based working hours, you are not only responsible for your working hours, but also for your work-life balance.Mobile working: If it gets too turbulent for you in our office, you can get the necessary balance through mobile working.Bike-Leasing: We support you in staying environmentally mobile and healthy.Corporate Benefits: Your opportunity for attractive offers and discounts from well-known suppliers and brands, e.g. Adidas, Apple, Expedia.Employee events: We not only want to grow together, but also celebrate our successes together.Lunch-Card: Be powerful with delicious energy, daily lunch budget is sponsored.Company Shuttle: Enjoy our convenient shuttle service that picks you up from Pasing in Munich and brings you to our location, with return trips at the end of the workday.
About us:Quantum Systems specialises in the development, design, and production of small Unmanned Aerial Systems (sUAS). The company‚Äôs range of electric vertical take-off and landing (eVTOL) sUAS are built to maximize range and versatility and to provide operators with a seamless user experience. By integrating cutting-edge software capabilities, like edge computing and real-time AI-powered data processing, Quantum Systems is building next-generation UAS for clients in defence, security, public sectors.Our commitment:We are an open-minded company that not only values diversity, but actively promotes it. Regardless of gender, age, ethnic origin, religion, sexual orientation or disability, we firmly believe that the diversity of our employees is an essential part of our success.At our company, every voice is heard and every perspective is valued. We believe that our differences enrich us and help us to find creative solutions and generate innovative ideas. We pride ourselves on creating an inclusive work environment where all employees can reach their full potential.

jobs.title: Mechanical Engineer
jobs.description:
About the job
            

            
                
                  At ITT, we have a clear purpose as an organization ‚Äì to provide our customers with cutting-edge solutions to help solve their most critical needs across key global end markets. Our continuous improvement mindset drives our commitment to evolving our capabilities as a multi-industrial technology, manufacturing and engineering leader. With a strong global footprint of more than 100 facilities, we are well positioned to solve critical challenges for our customers around the world. Our locations include manufacturing facilities and global service capabilities in 35 countries. Through these worldwide operations and building on our heritage of innovation, our approximately ~11,000 team members partner with our customers to deliver enduring solutions that make a lasting difference and help the world move forward. ITT is headquartered in Stamford, CT, with sales in approximately 125 countries. The company generated 2024 revenues of $3.6 billion.       Motion Technologies: (Revenue of $1.4B; headcount of ~ 4,000; operates in 13 countries) manufactures brake components and specialized sealing solutions, shock absorbers and damping technologies primarily for the global automotive, truck and trailer, public bus and rail transportation markets.  Industrial Process: (Revenue of $1.4B; headcount of ~3,400; operates in 30 countries) manufactures engineered fluid process equipment serving a diversified mix of customers in global industries such as chemical, energy, mining, and other industrial process markets and is a provider of plant optimization and efficiency solutions and aftermarket services and parts.  Connect and Control Technologies: (Revenue of $0.8B; headcount of ~ 3,800; operates in 10 countries) manufactures harsh-environment connector solutions, critical energy absorption, flow control components, and composite materials for the aerospace and defense, general industrial, medical, and energy markets. 
 Positions√ºbersicht We are looking for someone for our engineering department as soon as possible Mechanical engineer (f/m/d)Mechanical/hydraulic system planning & processing Grundlegende Verantwortlichkeiten Your areas of responsibility:       Creation of project and tender documents for pump systems and its auxiliary units as a ‚Äúturnkey process solution‚Äù. Responsibility for the construction and design of automated pump systems in the areas of layout planning, pipeline planning (with insulation and trace heating), valve selection, pressure design, instrumentation, explosion protection, structural planning, hydraulic auxiliary systems, etc. in interaction with qualified subcontractors. Calculations for the dimensioning and design of the system components (including according to ASME and AD2000) Close collaboration with the project team (including the project manager, the electrical engineer and the project buyer) Analysis and evaluation of customer specifications to support offers and project execution Examination of mechanical/hydraulic supply documents. Components in relation to the previously defined service description Planning and support of system function tests and technical support of the commissioning team (partial)
 Positionsanforderungen The requirements:       Completed studies as a mechanical engineer or comparable Several years of professional experience in the areas of responsibility described above Assumption of responsibility for work packages in the engineering of the products described Willingness to have customer contact Basic knowledge of process engineering systems desirable English spoken and written Good computer skills, user software (Autocad Inventor, Office package, Visio or similar) Flexible, goal- and cost-oriented working methods in project teams Willingness to travel occasionally as part of project meetings, sales and commissioning support, worldwide Ability to work in a team across departments

jobs.title: Mechanical Engineer - Humanoid (Human)
jobs.description:
About the job
            

            
                
                  Welcome to NEURA Robotics, the innovator of the robotics world. Our goal is to equip collaborative robots with groundbreaking cognitive capabilities to enable safe and intuitive collaboration with humans. Under the leadership of founder David Reger, we have spent the first years of NEURA Robotics laying the foundations for humans and robots to work hand in hand."We serve humanity" is not just a motto, but our mission. Become part of our ambitious, international company and shape the future of robotics with us.Welcome to NEURA Robotics - where innovation meets team spirit.Your mission & challenges:At the humanoid robot department, we are looking for multiple excellent humanoid robot developers to join our team. Your tasks will span a wide variety of topics connected to the need for developing 4NE-1, ranging from gearbox and motor design to structure parts and the outer shell of the robot. This includes:      Design of new powerful and lightweight robotic actuators and structural partsFinding innovative materials for roboticsDesign of both the outer shell and appearance of 4NE-1Finding new joint mechanismsTechnical drawings of parts
What we can look forward to:      Bachelor, Master's, or PhD degree in Mechanical Engineering or a similar fieldProficiency in Computer-Aided Design (CAD) Software (ideally Creo)Experience in manufacturing of parts, including party made of aluminum and plasticsExcellent and clear communication with suppliers, including bill of material and technical drawingsExperience in the (industrial) design of complex machines, electrical motors and gearboxes
What you can look forward to:      Become part of an agile company, actively shape topics and benefit from flat hierarchies in a highly motivated teamEnjoy an attractive salary, flexible working hours and 30 days of vacationThe freedom to contribute your own ideas and drive them forwardCelebrate successes together with company eventsTake advantage of our corporate benefits programAnd even more fun with great colleagues
We are looking forward to meeting you and shaping the future of robotics together. Are you in?

        NEURA Robotics is a German high-tech company founded in 2019 in Metzingen near Stuttgart with the goal to revolutionize the world of robotics. Our mission is to expand the skill set of collaborative robots with cognitive capabilities so that they can work with humans in existing environments without having to invest in complex and costly safety systems. We aim to help make numerous fields of work more attractive, safer, and more social. Our guiding principle ‚Äúwe serve humanity‚Äù sums up this mission.Today, more than 500 team members from over 45 countries are working on advanced technology in the fields of environmental perception, drive and control technology, materials science, mechanical design, and AI.By developing all key components such as AI, control software, sensor technology, and mechanical components in-house, the development team has made groundbreaking progress in a variety of areas.With products such as MAiRA, the world‚Äôs first cognitive robot, or MiPA, an intelligent versatile robotic assistant that will support people in all areas of life, humanity awaits a new era of robotics. NEURA Robotics is currently working on launching 4NE-1 (‚ÄúFor Anyone‚Äù), the first humanoid robot ready for series production.With the Neuraverse, a comprehensive ecosystem for innovations in the field of cognitive robotics, NEURA Robotics is creating an important technical basis for automation solutions and enabling the networking of robots and partner companies on a global scale.

Flache Hierarchien und kurze Entscheidungswege zeichnen uns aus. Komm in unser Team mit 8.000 Mitarbeitern in 44 L√§ndern weltweit. √úbernimm Verantwortung. Du modellierst 3D-Modelle und erstellst pr√§zise Zusammenstellungs-, Baugruppen- und Detailzeichnungen. jobs.title: Solar Simulation Engineer/ PVsyst Specialist (Contractor)
jobs.description:
About the job
            

            
                
                  About HuaweiHuawei is a leading global provider of information and communications technology (ICT) infrastructure and smart devices. With integrated solutions across four key domains - telecom networks, IT, smart devices, and cloud services - we are committed to bringing digital to every person, home and organization for a fully connected, intelligent world.At Huawei, innovation focuses on customer needs. We invest heavily in basic research, concentrating on technological breakthroughs that drive the world forward. We have more than 207,000 employees, and we operate in more than 170 countries and regions.Huawei's end-to-end portfolio of products, solutions and services are both competitive and secure. Through open collaboration with ecosystem partners, we create lasting value for our customers, working to empower people, enrich home life, and inspire innovation in organizations of all shapes and sizes.Job Title:Solar Simulation Engineer (PVsyst Specialist)Job Location:D√ºsseldorf, Germany orThe Hague, NetherlandsMain Responsibilities       Assist European representative offices in addressing customer PVsyst simulation needs to ensure accurate modeling and correct solution parameters.Support customers in performing PVsyst simulations, identifying and resolving potential issues related to system configuration, parameter settings, and performance analysis.Showcase our solution advantages through PVsyst simulations, providing technical insights and ensuring optimal results for clients.Enhance the PVsyst capabilities of European representative offices by offering training, best practices, and technical support.Collect and analyze common challenges faced by representative offices in PVsyst simulations, providing solutions to improve efficiency and accuracy.Develop PVsyst-related materials and documentation, including guidelines and training resources, to support business expansion.
RequirementsBasic Requirement:      Minimum 2-5 years of experience in PV system design, simulation, or technical support.Bachelor's or Master's degree in Electrical Engineering, Power Systems, Renewable Energy or a related field.Fluent in English 
Professional Knowledge      Proficiency in PVsyst and strong understanding of PV system simulation principles.Knowledge of PV system design, energy yield assessment, and inverter performance.Technical problem-solving abilities, particularly in PV system modeling and troubleshooting.Strong communication skills, capable of guiding and training technical teams across multiple European locations.Ability to collaborate with diverse teams, including local representative offices and Huawei HQ.Experience in working with PV projects, grid-connected systems, and performance analysis.Fluency in English
Key Skill      Foundations of AC systemsUnderstanding of PV systems Performance Ratio (PR).Full understanding of a PV utility scale system SLD and capability to translate it into a system configuration in "System" section of PVsyst software.Proven experience in full modelling and simulation of a utility scale PV system with PVsyst software:Electrical partitioning of PV tables according to PV module types (i.e. half-cut cells) for accurate shading analysis.Importing a complex shading scene generated by PVcase software for accurate PV site shading analysis."Power Sharing" feature usage when in presence of different configurations within MPPTs of same inverter, and between different inverters."Detailed Losses" modelling: ohmic losses on DC cabling, LV AC cabling, MV AC cabling, transformer losses at sub-array level according to cables specs and lengths, trafo specs (impedance, no-load losses, load losses), grid limitation at Point Of Connection (POC), mismatch, LID,..Understanding of the difference between P50 and P90 simulations.
Other Requirements      Ability to work independently, manage multiple projects, and collaborate with regional and global teams.
What We Offer: We offer you an exciting professional career in one of the leading and fastest growing multinational telecommunication companies, challenging work and a competitive salary package. Personal development is ensured through many training opportunities across Europe.Important: To be considered for this role, applicants must be eligible to work and live in the job location.Privacy StatementWe are committed to protecting your privacy by following the local legal data privacy legislation. By applying to this position at Huawei, you are giving us your consent to process your data. Please note that your data will be treated confidentially and securely.https://career.huawei.com/socRecruitment/euportal/portal/privacy-notice.htmlIf you have any queries in regards to Huawei Europe Data Privacy, please feel free to contact our European Data Protection Officer by clicking here .Department European DP Locations D√ºsseldorf, Germany Employment type Contract
